// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB): " for PvE Iâ€™d highly recommend bumping up the handling as much as possible. You can definitely spec out False Promises in a variety of different ways, and the higher base impact over other archetypes could mean end game potential (barring champion mods)." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb

// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "In PvP 360s have never been the best choice; they were niche, unforgiving, and heavy. But False Promises with good handling and DSR could mean you barely miss shots and unrelenting can keep the streak going for longer." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Hollow Words
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Precision fusion rifles have pretty vertical recoil patterns so you can instead spec into range to push out the damage drop off a tad or into stability to make the burst easier to control. All you have to do is break an enemiesâ€™ shield. Then, for 5 seconds they take 50% increased kinetic damage. This is huge because Hollow Words is an energy weapon so your Thorn, Spare or Dire all do 50% increased damage to both the body and the crit. Better yet it is team-wide. So you donâ€™t even have to finish the guardian whoâ€™s shield you broke. Anyone on your side has that increased kinetic damage." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB): "The Ikelos smg is back and thankfully we can add a touch of stability to make this gun less like a bucking bronco and more like an angry hedgehog. A high grenade build built upon Oppressive Darkness definitely comes to mind." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb

// Widow's Bite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB): "While I love the aesthetic of Veist weapons they all have been done before. Apostate, Twilight Oath, or even Omniscient Eye are all great PvP weapons with the ability for a good PvE roll. The Ikelos sniper has been reintroduced this season and just last season we got Distant Tumulus. The rapid-fire sniper rifle pool is so large compared to the aggressive frames. If this sniper were moved up two impact classes I could see it standing on its own, but Widowâ€™s Bite doesnâ€™t do anything remarkable that the aforementioned snipers canâ€™t do; and by now you already have a good roll on them." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb

// Widow's Bite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "While I love the aesthetic of Veist weapons they all have been done before. Apostate, Twilight Oath, or even Omniscient Eye are all great PvP weapons with the ability for a good PvE roll. The Ikelos sniper has been reintroduced this season and just last season we got Distant Tumulus. The rapid-fire sniper rifle pool is so large compared to the aggressive frames. If this sniper were moved up two impact classes I could see it standing on its own, but Widowâ€™s Bite doesnâ€™t do anything remarkable that the aforementioned snipers canâ€™t do; and by now you already have a good roll on them." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
